intro: Convolvulus lanuginosus, commonly known as the downy morning glory, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink, often opening in the morning. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed areas such as roadsides and waste grounds. Convolvulus lanuginosus is a perennial herb that can spread through both seeds and rhizomes.
